title: Angel Blowing a Trumpet
medium: graphite and watercolor on light blue wove paper
provenance_text:
Hilaire-Germain-Edgar Degas [1834-1917]; the artist's estate, until July 1919; Atelier Degas sale, Galerie Georges Petit, Paris, France, July 2-4 1919, no. 100c [1]; purchased by Durand-Ruel, Paris, France. Private collection, Paris, France [2]; Bianchini Gallery, New York, NY by June 1965 until December 1965 [3]; purchased by Museum, December 1965.
 
Notes:
[1]. "Tableaux, pastels et dessins par Edgar Degas et provenant de son atelier"; this was the 4th and last sale of the Atelier Degas. The work is listed as "Ange donnant de la trompette (Étude d’après un tableau ancient de l’ecole inalienne.)
[2]. Possibly Jean Pierre Selz (see note in curatorial file).
[3]. Bianchini loaned the work to "Master Drawings from Degas to Lichtenstein", Fort Worth Art Center, June 1-28, 1965.

Updated by CGK August 2012.

Under review by CGK (Check possible sale at Palais Galliera)
